23-013CP.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission Regular Meeting of Thursday, March 9, 2023.Page 1 of 6411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 6:30 PMWEDNESDAY, APRIL 19, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESA motion was made by Commissioner Buchanan, seconded by Commissioner Torres, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 5 - Dana Buchanan, David Ochoa, Rocio Torres, Merry Taheri and Michael SotoAbstain: 1 - Irma ArchuletaAbsent: 3 - Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Brent Walmsley and Michele AndersonPUBLIC COMMENT  (6:32 PM)Ahmed Mahmoud spoke.Graciela Espinoza Ortiz spoke.MANAGER'S REPORT  (6:43 PM)There was no report from Patrick Weithers, Manager of the CPCC.REMARKS FROM THE CHAIR AND COMMISSIONERS  (6:44 PM)Chair Soto spoke.RECESS TO CLOSED SESSION  (6:44 PM)At 6:44 PM, there being no objection, Chair Soto recessed the meeting to Closed Session.RECONVENE FROM CLOSED SESSION  (10:28 PM)At 10:28 PM, Chair Soto reconvened the meeting.ROLL CALL  (10:28 PM)Irma Archuleta, Dana Buchanan, David Ochoa, Rocio Torres, Merry Taheri and Michael Soto   Commissioners Present:Page 2 of 6411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 6:30 PMWEDNESDAY, APRIL 19, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESKenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Brent Walmsley and Michele Anderson   Commissioners Absent:2.

23-014CP.summary: Recommendation to receive Commission's vote and refer findings to the City Manager.Chair Soto reported out from Closed Session the following actions taken:[1] Case 22-070 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Racial Bias, 2 - Improper Detention, 3 - Improper Arrest, 4 - Unbecoming Conduct, 5 - Failure to Take Action, and 6 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[2] Case No. 22-049 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Vehicle Search, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct, 3 - Unbecoming Conduct, 4 - Unbecoming Conduct, and 5 - Bias Based Policing for Officer accused;[3] Case No. 22-059 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Failure to Take Action, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct, and 3 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[4] Case No. 22-071 Commissioners voted 5-0-1 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Failure to Take Report, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct, and 3 - Unbecoming Conduct for First and Second Officers accused;[5] Case No. 22-046 Commissioners voted 4-0-2 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 5-0-1 on Allegation Nos. 2 - Failure to Take Action, and 3 - Racial Bias for Officer accused;[6] Case No. 22-065 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Use of Force for First, Second, and Third Officers accused, 2 - Use of Force for Officer accused, and 3 - Use of Force for First and Second Officers accused; [7] Case No. 22-063 Commissioners voted 5-1 on Allegation No. 1 - Racial Profiling, 3 - Unbecoming Conduct, and 6-0 on Allegation No. 2 - Use of Force for First and Second Officers accused;[8] Case No. 22-087 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct and 2 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;Page 3 of 6411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 6:30 PMWEDNESDAY, APRIL 19, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTES[9] Case No. 22-068 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Failure to Take Action and 5-0-1 on Allegation No. 2 - Racial Bias for Officer accused;[10] Case No. 22-057 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Failure to Take Report and 2 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[11] Case No. 22-103 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Failure to Investigate for First and Second Officers accused.[12] Case No. 22-069 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Personal Search for Officer accused;[13] Case No. 22-086 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[14] Case No. 22-064 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused; and[15] Case No. 22-062 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Harassment for First, Second, and Third Officers accused.A motion was made by Commissioner Archuleta, seconded by Commissioner Ochoa, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - Irma Archuleta, Dana Buchanan, David Ochoa, Rocio Torres, Merry Taheri and Michael SotoAbsent: 3 - Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Brent Walmsley and Michele Anderson3.
